question: Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/html/index.html and return the exact H1 text.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/data.json and return the value of the 'title' key.
Request http://127.0.0.1:31415/notfound and report the HTTP status code.
Call http://127.0.0.1:31415/headers and explicitly set the X-Debug header to "hello" via the fetch tool headers parameter (otherwise the endpoint returns "none"); return the echoed value.
Follow the redirect at http://127.0.0.1:31415/redirect1 and return the final URL path.
Use the fetch tool with method HEAD on http://127.0.0.1:31415/html/about.html and return the Content-Length header value.
Send a HEAD request to http://127.0.0.1:31415/compressed and report the Content-Encoding header.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/compressed and return the value of the 'note' field from the JSON body.
Call http://127.0.0.1:31415/query?category=fruits&limit=2 (or equivalently use params) and return the 'summary' field.
Query http://127.0.0.1:31415/query?category=colors&limit=1 (or set the same params manually) and return the 'first' value from the JSON response.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/auth and include X-Token: opensesame via the fetch tool headers parameter (the endpoint returns 401 if you skip it); return the 'secret' value.
Call http://127.0.0.1:31415/auth without any X-Token header and report the HTTP status code.
Follow the redirect chain starting at http://127.0.0.1:31415/redirect_chain and return the final URL path.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/text/poem.txt and return the final line of the file.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/html/latin1.html and return the H1 text.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/data.json and report the value of the 'count' field.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/data.json and return the name of the item where id=3.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/data_large.jsonl and return the sha256 hash reported by the tool (use default max_bytes).
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/data_large.jsonl with max_bytes set to 64 and report whether the response was truncated (answer true or false).
Repeat the fetch of http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/data_large.jsonl with max_bytes=64 and return the recorded byte count.
Call http://127.0.0.1:31415/headers and set X-Debug: diagnostics via the fetch tool headers parameter (missing the header produces "none"); return the echoed value.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/compressed and state whether the 'ok' field in the JSON body is true.
Send a HEAD request to http://127.0.0.1:31415/notfound and report the HTTP status code.
Query http://127.0.0.1:31415/query?category=shapes&limit=5 (or set those params explicitly) and return the 'count' reported by the server.
Use the fetch tool to read http://127.0.0.1:31415/text/poem.txt and summarize the poem in no more than 20 words.
expected: Short deterministic-poem summary highlighting reliable servers and flowing signals.

question: Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/query?category=fruits&limit=4 and provide a concise (<25 words) takeaway that names at least two fruits and states how many results were returned.
expected: Summary mentioning two fruits and noting the count of four entries.

question: Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/data_large.jsonl and report the sum of all decimal digits in the sha256 hash returned by the fetch tool (answer as an integer).
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/text/poem.txt and count how many times the letter 'o' appears across the entire poem (case-insensitive). Return the count as an integer.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/text/poem.txt again and count the occurrences of the letter 'i' (case-insensitive) across all lines. Answer with the integer count.
Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/ledger.json and sum every entry whose "type" is "expense". Return the integer total.
Fetch the same ledger and compute the net balance defined as (sum of income amounts) minus (sum of expense amounts) minus (sum of refund amounts). Answer with the integer result.
Call http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/pointers.json, locate the path for key "ember", fetch that text file, and return the final token mentioned on line 3 (omit punctuation).
Use the pointers map to find the path for "relay", fetch it, and reply with the hyphenated password printed in that file.
Via extras.checksum in the pointers map, reach the checksum hints JSON and sum the "value" fields for entries whose "source" is "north". Respond with the integer sum.

Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/checksum_hints.json. Count how many numbers in "sequence" are greater than 2, then multiply that count by the combined values of segments whose source is east or west. Return the integer product.
Use /json/pointers.json to locate "sequence". Fetch the referenced text file and count the number of words in the sentence that begins with "Second sentence". Return the integer count.
Fetch /json/pointers.json, follow the "directive" path, obey the instructions inside, and report the uppercase code from the HTML manifest.
Fetch the ledger JSON and compute the average of the expense amounts (only entries where type == "expense") rounded to one decimal place. Return that decimal number.

Fetch http://127.0.0.1:31415/json/ledger.json and provide a concise (<=25 words) summary that mentions both total expenses (46) and total income (58) and clearly states whether expenses exceed income.
Follow the directive instructions to retrieve the manifest HTML, then write a <=25 word report that states the final code and reminds the reader it must be uppercase.
expected: Brief manifest report mentioning uppercase requirement.
